abstracts.cdata!:
From the point of view of delivery of
            the planned results, project outcome is satisfactory for all
            components. Project sustainability is unlikely: to a large
            extent it depends on factors that are the result of overall
            Government policies and/or in Tajikistan's
            macro-economic conditions and are therefore, outside the
            control of the project area's population and/or
            authorities. Both World Bank and Borrower performances are
            adjudged as satisfactory despite the shortfall in Bank
            budgetary resources and the prevailing circumstances.
            Lessons learned included the following: Projects like this
            that are prepared in a very short time with a view to
            respond swiftly to a natural disaster or another emergency,
            cannot be prepared with the same degree of detail as a
            traditional operation. They have to have built-in a great
            deal of flexibility to adequately address unforeseeable
            needs as they revolve from the reconstruction process. In
            keeping with the political nature of the project objective,
            the project coordination unit tried to spread project
            operations geographically as widely as possible with the aim
            of reaching out to the communities. While logical from a
            political perspective, this approach made visibility more
            important than realistically assessing the usefulness of the
            operation for community development. A related issue is the
            diversity of sectors coverd by the project; was the modest
            objective already too ambitious given the country's
            capacity and budget resources.

5084234.trustfund:
TF021299-COFINANCING THE TAJIKISTAN
            POST-CONFLICT REHABILITATION PROJECT,TF034640-ECA REGION - PILOT RECONSTRUCTION,TF023473-PHRD - POST-CONFLICT
            RECONSTRUCTION PROJECT,TF036435-TAJIKISTAN - P-C RECONSTRUCTION
            (POST CONFLICT),TF035605-TAJIKISTAN - POST CONFLICT
            ASSISTANCE PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The primary objective of the
            Post-conflict Emergency Reconstruction Project is to support
            the Government's strategy for the successful
            implementation of the Peace Agreement by facilitating the
            reintegration of the Karategin-Tavildara Valley area into
            the national economy through a targeted agricultural
            development.  The project will help finance the following
            components: a) agricultural support including the emergency
            purchase and distribution of agricultural inputs to private
            farmers for the Spring 1998 planting season; b) bridges and
            roads providing for the repair or reconstruction of about
            fifteen destroyed or damaged bridges as well as the
            completion of a 4kms by-pass road for the town of Darband to
            replace the currently existing non-functional road; c) small
            community works aiming at the reconstruction, repair and/or
            rehabilitation of destroyed, damaged or dilapidated schools,
            health care facilities and other community facilities as
            well as the implementation of other programs of small works
            benefiting local communities in the Karategin-Tavildara
            Valley area; and d) other infrastructure works providing for
            the repair and rehabilitation of war-damaged infrastructure
            elements in the power and agriculture sector.
